perturbation.original_text:
1.9 “ELEPHANT TALK Customer” shall mean any company or legal entity partnering with ELEPHANT TALK, which wishes to offer mobile
services in a MVNO/ESP/SP model using the T-Mobile Network and the by T-Mobile provided Hosting Services under the terms and
conditions as mentioned in this Agreement. ELEPHANT TALK Customers might include the mobile end-users of ELEPHANT TALK
Customers, subject to the interpretation of the specific provision.
perturbation.changed_text:
1.9 “ELEPHANT TALK Customer” shall mean any company or legal entity partnering with ELEPHANT TALK, which wishes to offer mobile
services in a MVNO/ESP/SP model using the T-Mobile Network and the by T-Mobile provided Hosting Services under the terms and
conditions as mentioned in this Agreement. ELEPHANT TALK Customers specifically exclude mobile end-users of ELEPHANT TALK Customers.
perturbation.explanation: The original definition includes mobile end-users of ELEPHANT TALK Customers based on interpretation, whereas the modified version explicitly excludes them. This contradiction could lead to disputes over service provision and liability related to end-users.

perturbation.original_text:
17.1 This Agreement shall come into force on the Date of the Agreement, and shall, subject to article 18, remain in full force and effect for an
initial period of *** from the Commercial Launch Date.
perturbation.changed_text:
17.1 This Agreement shall come into force on the Date of the Agreement, and shall, subject to article 18, remain in full force and effect for an
initial period of *** from the Date of the Agreement.
perturbation.explanation: The original text states that the agreement remains in effect for an initial period from the Commercial Launch Date, but the modified text indicates it's from the Date of the Agreement. This creates confusion over when the agreement effectively begins and ends, impacting obligations and timelines.

perturbation.original_text:
18.1 In addition to the conditions of Article 17, this Agreement may be terminated as follows:

a.	by mutual agreement of the Parties; or

b.	by either Party, with immediate effect, if the other Party is in material breach of any provision of this Agreement and does not or is not
capable of remedying such breach within a reasonable time and in any event within sixty (60) Business Days of receipt of a written
notice to such effect. A material breach will, for the purpose of this Agreement, not include the event that ELEPHANT TALK fails to
comply with its payments obligations under article 9.2.; or
perturbation.changed_text:
18.1 In addition to the conditions of Article 17, this Agreement may be terminated as follows:

a.	by mutual agreement of the Parties; or

b.	by either Party, with immediate effect, if the other Party is in material breach of any provision of this Agreement and does not or is not
capable of remedying such breach within a reasonable time and in any event within sixty (60) Business Days of receipt of a written
notice to such effect. A material breach specifically includes the event that ELEPHANT TALK fails to comply with its payment obligations under article 9.2.; or
perturbation.explanation: The original clause excludes failure to comply with payment obligations under article 9.2 from being considered a material breach, whereas the modified clause includes it. This contradiction directly impacts the circumstances under which the agreement can be terminated, creating uncertainty about remedies for non-payment.
